p: Direct competition between coral species played an important role when simulated reefs were undisturbed by extreme thermal events and mechanical disturbance events (Fig. 1). In these conditions trait diversity within the community stayed high (Appendix 1: Table S3) and nearly all species survived. The occurrence of mechanical disturbance events favoured branching corals when total initial coral cover was low (20%), but not when initial cover was high (100%). Furthermore, the occurrence of mechanical disturbance levels favoured fast-growing coral species over competitive ones.
